sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1:
Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. 
Find (A × B) ∩ {(x, y) | x ∈ A ∩ B, y ∈ B} and compare it with (B × A) ∩ {(x, y) | x ∈ A, y ∈ A ∩ B}. Is the result the same or different? Explain why.
